1.text: Wisdom has built her house, she has hewn out her seven pillars:

2.text: She has killed her beasts; she has mingled her wine; she has also furnished her table.

3.text: She has sent forth her maidens: she cries on the highest places of the city,

4.text: Whoever is simple, let him turn in here: as for him that wants understanding, she said to him,

5.text: Come, eat of my bread, and drink of the wine which I have mingled.

6.text: Forsake the foolish, and live; and go in the way of understanding.

7.text: He that reproves a scorner gets to himself shame: and he that rebukes a wicked man gets himself a blot.

8.text: Reprove not a scorner, lest he hate you: rebuke a wise man, and he will love you.

9.text: Give instruction to a wise man, and he will be yet wiser: teach a just man, and he will increase in learning.

10.text: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom: and the knowledge of the holy is understanding.

11.text: For by me your days shall be multiplied, and the years of your life shall be increased.

12.text: If you be wise, you shall be wise for yourself: but if you scorn, you alone shall bear it.

13.text: A foolish woman is clamorous: she is simple, and knows nothing.

14.text: For she sits at the door of her house, on a seat in the high places of the city,

15.text: To call passengers who go right on their ways:

16.text: Whoever is simple, let him turn in here: and as for him that wants understanding, she said to him,

17.text: Stolen waters are sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant.

18.text: But he knows not that the dead are there; and that her guests are in the depths of hell.
